Questions.Text: Emily has 12 apples, and her friend gives her 8 more apples. How many apples does Emily have now?
There are 25 students in a class. If 15 more students join the class, how many students are there in total?
Jake has 5 toy cars, and his brother gives him 7 more. How many toy cars does Jake have in total?
Lily picked 16 flowers and then picked 9 more flowers. How many flowers did Lily pick altogether?
There are 10 ducks in a pond. If 14 more ducks join them, how many ducks are in the pond now?
A farmer has 30 cows in one field and 18 cows in another field. How many cows does he have in total?
Sophie has 9 stickers, and her friend gives her 11 more stickers. How many stickers does Sophie have now?
Tom has 22 marbles, and he finds 13 more marbles in his bag. How many marbles does Tom have now?
There are 7 red balloons and 9 blue balloons at a party. How many balloons are there in total?
A pet shop has 20 puppies and gets 15 more puppies. How many puppies does the pet shop have now?
Anna has 14 books, and her mom buys her 6 more books. How many books does Anna have in total?
A pizza place made 25 pizzas for a party and 10 more pizzas for another event. How many pizzas did they make in total?
Max collected 18 seashells at the beach and found 7 more seashells. How many seashells does Max have now?
There are 13 kids on the playground, and 9 more kids come to play. How many kids are on the playground now?
A garden has 11 roses and 14 tulips. How many flowers are there in the garden?
Lisa has 5 dolls and her grandma gives her 10 more dolls. How many dolls does Lisa have now?
A box contains 19 chocolates, and another box has 23 chocolates. How many chocolates are there in total?
There are 17 cars in the parking lot, and 6 more cars arrive. How many cars are there now?
A school has 28 desks and buys 12 more desks. How many desks does the school have now?
Kevin has 36 baseball cards and gets 24 more cards from his friend. How many baseball cards does Kevin have in total?
A library has 40 books on one shelf and 30 books on another shelf. How many books are there altogether?
There are 15 cookies on the table, and Mom adds 10 more cookies. How many cookies are there now?
In a fruit basket, there are 22 oranges and 17 apples. How many fruits are there in total?
Emma had 25 candies. She gave 8 candies to her friend. How many candies does Emma have left?
There are 40 apples in a basket. 15 apples were taken out. How many apples are still in the basket?
Liam has 50 toy cars. He lost 12 of them. How many toy cars does Liam have now?
Sophia had 30 stickers. She used 9 stickers for her scrapbook. How many stickers are left?
A farmer has 70 cows. 20 cows went to the market. How many cows does the farmer have now?
In a classroom, there are 27 students. 5 students went to the library. How many students are in the classroom now?
Jake had 45 marbles. He gave 17 marbles to his brother. How many marbles does Jake have left?
Mia baked 60 cookies. She sold 24 cookies at the bake sale. How many cookies does she have now?
There are 80 balloons at a party. 33 balloons popped. How many balloons are still inflated?
Noah has 55 crayons. He lost 18 crayons. How many crayons does Noah have left?
A zoo has 90 animals. 25 of them are birds. How many animals are not birds?
Lucy has 34 books. She donated 10 books to the library. How many books does she have now?
A toy store had 100 dolls. They sold 45 dolls. How many dolls are left in the store?
Tom had 66 cookies. He ate 22 of them. How many cookies does Tom have left?
A gardener planted 75 flowers. 20 flowers died. How many flowers are still alive?
A library has 120 books. 37 books were checked out. How many books are still in the library?
Ella has 88 stickers. She gave 29 stickers to her friend. How many stickers does she have now?
A pet shop had 55 fish. 18 fish were sold. How many fish are left in the shop?
There are 67 students in the school band. 19 students left the band. How many students are still in the band?
A bakery made 50 loaves of bread. They sold 28 loaves. How many loaves of bread are still available?
Kevin has 42 baseball cards. He lost 14 cards. How many baseball cards does Kevin have now?
A box contains 78 crayons. 30 crayons were used. How many crayons are left in the box?
There were 89 ducks in the pond. 23 ducks flew away. How many ducks are left in the pond?
Sarah has 95 stickers. She gave 34 stickers to her friends. How many stickers does Sarah have left?
A school has 100 desks. 47 desks are broken. How many desks are still usable?
There are 7 bags of apples. Each bag contains 4 apples. How many apples are there in total?
A pack of stickers has 6 sheets, and each sheet has 8 stickers. How many stickers are there in total?
Samantha has 5 boxes of crayons. Each box has 10 crayons. How many crayons does she have in total?
There are 9 children in a class, and each child has 3 toy cars. How many toy cars are there altogether?
A farmer has 4 fields, and each field has 20 rows of corn. How many rows of corn are there in total?
Each pack of gum contains 5 pieces, and Lily bought 9 packs. How many pieces of gum did she buy?
There are 6 floors in a building, and each floor has 12 apartments. How many apartments are there in total?
A pizza is cut into 8 slices. If there are 5 pizzas, how many slices are there in total?
There are 3 packs of balloons, and each pack has 15 balloons. How many balloons are there altogether?
Each teacher has 4 sets of books, and each set contains 6 books. How many books does one teacher have?
A box contains 10 chocolates, and there are 6 boxes. How many chocolates are there in total?
Julia has 8 packets of seeds, and each packet contains 5 seeds. How many seeds does she have in total?
There are 4 teams in a game, and each team has 9 players. How many players are there in total?
A basket contains 7 bunches of grapes, and each bunch has 6 grapes. How many grapes are there altogether?
If one book has 3 chapters and there are 9 books, how many chapters are there in total?
A toy store has 11 shelves, and each shelf holds 8 toys. How many toys are there in the store?
There are 5 groups of students, and each group has 6 students. How many students are there in total?
A bakery makes 9 trays of cookies, and each tray has 10 cookies. How many cookies are made in total?
In a garden, there are 4 rows of flowers, and each row has 7 flowers. How many flowers are there in total?
A classroom has 10 desks, and each desk can hold 2 books. How many books can the classroom hold?
If there are 8 students in a class and each student has 3 notebooks, how many notebooks are there altogether?
A car can carry 4 passengers. If there are 6 cars, how many passengers can be carried in total?
There are 7 days in a week. How many days are there in 9 weeks?
Each dog needs 5 bones, and there are 4 dogs. How many bones do the dogs need in total?
A movie theater has 3 screens, and each screen can show 12 movies a week. How many movies can be shown in total?
There are 36 candies and 9 friends. If they share the candies equally, how many candies does each friend get?
A farmer has 48 apples and wants to pack them into boxes with 8 apples in each box. How many boxes does he need?
There are 72 pencils and 8 students. If each student gets the same number of pencils, how many pencils does each student get?
A baker made 56 cookies and wants to put them on plates with 7 cookies on each plate. How many plates does he need?
There are 90 stickers and 10 kids at the party. If they share the stickers equally, how many stickers does each kid get?
A toy store has 64 toy cars. If they display them in groups of 8, how many groups can they make?
A teacher has 30 crayons and wants to give them to 5 students. How many crayons will each student receive?
There are 45 cupcakes and 9 plates. If each plate gets the same number of cupcakes, how many cupcakes are on each plate?
A library has 81 books and wants to place them on 9 shelves. How many books will be on each shelf?
A gardener has 50 flowers and wants to plant them in rows with 10 flowers in each row. How many rows can he plant?
There are 100 balloons and 4 birthday parties. If the balloons are shared equally, how many balloons does each party get?
A soccer coach has 36 players and wants to divide them into teams of 6. How many teams can he make?
There are 24 oranges and 6 baskets. If the oranges are distributed equally among the baskets, how many oranges will be in each basket?
A chef made 54 sandwiches and wants to serve them on plates with 6 sandwiches on each plate. How many plates does he need?
A class has 60 crayons and they need to share them equally among 10 students. How many crayons does each student get?
There are 40 marbles and 5 bags. If the marbles are divided equally into the bags, how many marbles are in each bag?
A zoo has 72 animals and wants to divide them into groups of 8. How many groups will there be?
A teacher has 42 stickers and wants to give them to 6 students equally. How many stickers will each student get?
There are 28 cookies and 4 plates at a bake sale. If the cookies are shared equally, how many cookies will each plate have?
A pack of cards has 52 cards and needs to be divided into 4 equal piles. How many cards will be in each pile?
A pet store has 80 fish and wants to place them in tanks with 10 fish in each tank. How many tanks are needed?
There are 18 students in a class and they need to be divided into groups of 3 for a project. How many groups will they form?
A gardener has 90 seeds and wants to plant them in rows of 10. How many rows can he plant?
A birthday cake has 36 slices and there are 6 kids at the party. If they share the slices equally, how many slices does each kid get?
